text: Updated ESPN story on assistant coach Mitch Johnson succeeding Gregg Popovich as the San Antonio Spurs' next head coach: https://t.co/DM6CVKk1iO

author: ShamsCharania
text: By choosing Johnson as the organization’s new coach, the Spurs maintain the continuity and through-line laid out by Popovich and CEO RC Buford, as well as general manager Brian Wright, who was hired in the same 2016 offseason as Johnson.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Breaking: The San Antonio Spurs are hiring assistant Mitch Johnson as the franchise's next head coach, sources tell ESPN. Johnson has been an assistant in Spurs program for a decade, took over as interim coach in November – and now earns job as Gregg Popovich's successor. https://t.co/43tpK5gEA9

author: ShamsCharania
text: ESPN story on Gregg Popovich stepping away from his legendary, 29-year run as San Antonio Spurs head coach to become the full-time president of basketball: https://t.co/DM6CVKk1iO

author: ShamsCharania
text: This is the end of an era as Popovich, 76, has served as Spurs coach since 1996. And a start of another era: Popovich has already been involved throughout the Spurs offseason in President of Basketball role and will continue to be a vital member of their operations, sources said.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Gregg Popovich will no longer be Head Coach of the San Antonio Spurs and is transitioning full-time to Team President, sources told ESPN. The iconic Popovich is a Basketball Hall of Famer, the NBA’s all-time winningest coach, and led the Spurs to five championships. https://t.co/mbtUtpgA4V

text: After conversations with Tyrese Haliburton’s father John Haliburton and the Indiana Pacers front office, John Haliburton will not attend the team’s home and road games for the foreseeable future, a Pacers spokesperson told ESPN.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Jae Crowder: Abdominal repairs have a high success rate and Dr. Bob Myers is the best in field. However, most cases occur in the offseason or late in the year and end up being season-ending issues.

author: InStreetClothes
text: However, Crowder's tear was likely one he could not have played through and a proactive approach to treatment should allow him to return this season. The average time lost for players that had in-season abdominal repairs and returned in the same season is 30 games (~9.3 weeks).

author: ChrisBHaynes
text:
Otto Porter Jr. announced he’s retiring:
 
“For the past 11 years, I had the chance to live my lifelong dream of playing in the NBA,” said Porter Jr. “That dream was capped by winning an NBA Championship! Unfortunately, my body is not allowing me to play at the level that I expect of myself, and I have therefore decided to retire.”

author: InStreetClothes
text:
Re: Steven Adams: The PCL crisscrosses behind its better-known counterpart the ACL & works primarily to prevent knee hyperextension. It also acts as the central axis for knee rotation. Isolated PCL tears are relatively rare w/ surgery resulting in substantial time lost.

Just a massive blow for the Grizzles.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sources: Damian Lillard cleared of blood clot in just over three weeks, off blood-thinning meds - ESPN: https://t.co/4dsQMSYHaW

author: ShamsCharania
text: Remarkable and historic development to clear from the blood clot in just over 3 weeks. Doctors have told Bucks officials this recovery has never been seen before – but occurred due to early treatment, detection, and specialists working on Lillard even before formal diagnosis.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Amazing: Milwaukee's Damian Lillard has been cleared of his deep vein thrombosis and is no longer on blood-thinning medication, sources tell ESPN. Lillard is out for Game 1 Saturday against Indiana and will have a period of time to resume contact workouts and ramp up for return. https://t.co/fbeQg0mvsn

author: ShamsCharania
text: ESPN story on the Sacramento Kings reuniting with 25-year NBA executive Scott Perry as their next general manager: https://t.co/Eh3feeBtkh

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Sacramento Kings are finalizing a deal to hire longtime NBA executive Scott Perry as their new general manager, sources tell ESPN. Perry spent three months with the Kings in 2017 before leaving for the Knicks. Perry started his exec career in 2000 with Detroit. https://t.co/vlQUOeo55y

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Sacramento Kings and general manager Monte McNair are mutually parting ways, sources tell ESPN. McNair spent five seasons running the Kings, winning NBA executive of the year in 2023 when Sacramento went 48-34 and snapped a record 16-year drought to make the playoffs. https://t.co/off3QWsZnU

author: ShamsCharania
text: ESPN story on the Sacramento Kings and GM Monte McNair mutually parting ways after five seasons: https://t.co/8T5CGrU2j5

author: ShamsCharania
text:
The Kings have won 40 or more games in three straight seasons under McNair’s leadership. Before this streak, they had not won 40 games in any season since 2005-06. 

The Kings had a .488 win percentage under McNair — compared to a .362 win percentage for the 15 years prior.

text: .@Dame_Lillard to @NBAonTNT, @BleacherReport on becoming teammates with Pat Beverley (@patbev21): “First, I want to say I’m sad to see Cam [Payne] go. We developed a friendship that I cherish. As for Pat, he brings an edge and a defensive tenacity on the perimeter that we need. There are not many players who bring it on a nightly like him. I look forward to working together. Our past personal issues don’t trump an opportunity to win a championship.”

author: ShamsCharania
text: ESPN story on the Suns firing coach Mike Budenholzer after a failed season with the highest payroll in NBA history – beginning a summer of major changes that will include working with Kevin Durant and his business partner Rich Kleiman on a trade: https://t.co/aBiYfCWTZ3

author: ShamsCharania
text:
A year after 49 wins, the sixth seed and the No. 13 ranked defense, the Suns plummeted to third-worst in the NBA on defense and went 10-18 after the All-Star break. 

For the third straight offseason, Phoenix is changing coaches.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: The Phoenix Suns have fired head coach Mike Budenholzer after finishing in 11th place with a 36-46 record in his one season, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/ocySLmWDQI

author: ShamsCharania
text: Reporting for NBA Today on arguably the most shocking in-season coach firing in league history with Nuggets dismissing Michael Malone – and players left surprised when informed: https://t.co/kcR1MqAQBX

author: ShamsCharania
text: This is tied for the latest coaching change in NBA history, per ESPN Research, matching Hubie Brown in 1980-81.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Lead assistant David Adelman will serve as the interim head coach for the Nuggets, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Full clean out: The Denver Nuggets are also firing general manager Calvin Booth, sources tell ESPN. Michael Malone and Booth both out today. https://t.co/FvqOAFyOKy

author: ShamsCharania
text: Days before the NBA playoffs, the Nuggets dismissed Malone in a meeting today. Malone is the winningest coach in franchise history since being hired in 2015 – and led the Nuggets to the 2023 NBA championship.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: The Denver Nuggets have fired coach Michael Malone, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/bZoKRx6kgt

author: ShamsCharania
text: Bucks executive and former six-year NBA forward Ronald Dupree is returning to alma mater LSU as the general manager of the men's basketball program, sources tell ESPN. Dupree spent eight years with Bucks front office, and now becomes among few ex-standout players as school GM.

author: ShamsCharania
text:
2025 Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame:

Carmelo Anthony, Dwight Howard, Sue Bird, Maya Moore, Sylvia Fowles, Danny Crawford, 2008 U.S. Olympic men's team, Billy Donovan, Micky Arison.

author: ShamsCharania
text: WNBA legends: Sue Bird and Maya Moore have been elected into the Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame Class of 2025, sources tell ESPN. Bird: 13 WNBA All-Star teams, four championships. Moore: four-time champion, six-time All-Star. https://t.co/g6loNtDfor

author: ShamsCharania
text: Dwight Howard recently said on his podcast @DH12abovetherim that he was jobless before joining the Lakers for the 2019-20 season. He proceeded to win a championship. And now he has that accolade en route to the Hall of Fame – a dream fulfilled.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Dwight Howard has been elected as a first-ballot member of the Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame Class of 2025, sources tell ESPN. Howard was an 8-time All-Star, 8-time All-NBA, 3-time Defensive Player of Year, a 2020 NBA champion, and won one Olympic gold medal with Team USA. https://t.co/PMcyw6Izew

author: InStreetClothes
text: As with all meniscus injuries, treatment options are often dictated by the location of the tear. For a true repair to occur, the damage has to occur to a specific area. Otherwise a meniscectomy (removal) may be the only course of care.

author: ShamsCharania
text:
Glen Taylor, 83, purchased the Timberwolves for $94 million in 1994.

Now, 31 years later, Taylor agrees to sell for $1.5 billion – the original price tag from his deal with Marc Lore and Alex Rodriguez.

💰💰💰

author: ShamsCharania
text:
ESPN story: After years-long standoff, Glen Taylor has agreed in principle to complete a 100% ownership transfer of the Minnesota Timberwolves and Lynx to Marc Lore and Alex Rodriguez.

https://t.co/gCwuV1HPSX

author: ShamsCharania
text: Glen Taylor has agreed on Marc Lore-Alex Rodriguez acquiring 100% ownership of the Minnesota Timberwolves and Lynx at the same $1.5 billion tag the sides reached in 2021, sources said.

author: ShamsCharania
text: After years long battle, Glen Taylor and Marc Lore-Alex Rodriguez have agreed to complete full ownership to Lore-Rodriguez, sources tell ESPN. Taylor will not appeal Minnesota arbitrators that ruled in favor of Lore-Rodriguez in February. NBA will start transfer process.

author: ShamsCharania
text:
NBA discipline for Pistons-Timberwolves scuffle, sources tell ESPN:

- Isaiah Stewart: 2 game suspension
- Donte DiVincenzo: 1 game suspension
- Ron Holland: 1 game suspension
- Naz Reid: 1 game suspension
- Marcus Sasser: 1 game suspension

text: After two 10-day contracts, the New York Knicks are planning to sign veteran forward PJ Tucker to a two-year deal, sources tell ESPN. Tucker will return to the Knicks through the season and playoffs, with a team option for 2025-26.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Notre Dame's Olivia Miles – the projected No. 2 pick in the WNBA draft this month – will forgo the draft and enter NCAA's transfer portal, sources tell ESPN. The 22-year-old top prospect makes unprecedented decision to use her one year remaining of college instead of the draft. https://t.co/NaODcCzc38

author: ShamsCharania
text: Both forgoing the draft as a top 2 projected pick and transferring out of Notre Dame – following a Sweet 16 run – make this unprecedented for Olivia Miles.

text: Like discussed with Damar Hamlin, it’s important to remember cardiac arrest is not a heart attack. Cardiac arrest means the injury involved the electrical system of the heart, not impended blood flow. Continued prayers & support for the James family but happy to hear he’s stable.

text: ESPN story on Hornets star LaMelo Ball ruled out for the remainder of the season as he undergoes minor procedures on his right ankle and wrist: https://t.co/Isi4YSvXyo

author: ShamsCharania
text: Team doctors and outside specialists concluded that the two procedures will allow Ball to heal and have a full offseason. The decision ends Ball’s career year in scoring. He is the first player in Hornets history to average 25 points and 7 assists in a season, per ESPN research.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Charlotte Hornets star LaMelo Ball will miss the rest of the season as he undergoes two minor procedures to address ankle and wrist issues, sources tell ESPN. Ball showed toughness, playing through pain in recent weeks, before he and team consulted doctors on best course forward. https://t.co/PrpWrjaXuW

author: ShamsCharania
text:
Dallas Mavericks All-Star Kyrie Irving underwent successful surgery to repair his torn left ACL on Wednesday at Hospital for Special Surgery in New York City. 

The surgery was performed by HSS Chief of Sports Medicine, Dr. Riley J. Williams.

text: Re: Amen Thompson: Unsurprising to see him ruled out for the rest of summer league. A Grade 2 sprain is also known as a partial or incomplete tear. Players to sustain G2 ankle sprains include Mike Conley, LaMelo Ball, & Ja Morant. Historically, the average time lost is ~3 weeks.

author: ShamsCharania

The Grousbeck's purchased the Celtics for $360 million in 2002.

In 2025, the family sells for $6.1 billion.

💰💰💰

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Boston Celtics' sale of $6.1 billion surpasses the NFL's Washington Commanders ($6.05 billion) for the highest sum ever for a North America sports team.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Bill Chisholm, managing partner at Symphony Technology Group, has agreed to purchase the Boston Celtics from the Grousbeck family for a valuation for $6.1 billion, sources tell ESPN. This now is the largest sale for a sports franchise in North America. https://t.co/iPphqSQswe

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sacramento Kings star Domantas Sabonis will miss at least 10 days with a right ankle sprain, sources tell ESPN. The NBA's leading rebounder returned last week after sitting for six straight games, and will now miss additional time. Kings are 3-6 without Sabonis.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Sacramento Kings are signing forward Terry Taylor to a 10-day contract out of their NBA G League affiliate Stockton, his agent Darrell Comer tells ESPN. Taylor has averaged 17.5 points, 8.4 rebounds and 3.4 assists for Stockton.

author: ShamsCharania
text: New Orleans Pelicans forward Trey Murphy III has suffered a season-ending torn labrum in his right shoulder, sources tell ESPN. Murphy was in the midst of a career NBA season in his fourth campaign, averaging 21.2 points and posting his third year with 150+ made 3s. https://t.co/vgPQZvRIvX

author: ShamsCharania

author: ShamsCharania
text: New Boston Celtics owner Bill Chisholm tells ESPN: "The team is in a great place right now, and I'm very sensitive to that. Wyc, Brad (Stevens) and Joe (Mazzulla) have done amazing jobs... My approach is to win and raise banners. That's in the near term and the long term."

author: ShamsCharania
text: Chrisholm: "I bleed green. I love the Celtics. When opportunity came up, I couldn't pass it up. Wyc has done an incredible job. So why would you mess that up? I've had a couple of sitdowns with Brad and it's been about aligning our goals, and extending the window of this team."

author: InStreetClothes
text: Congrats to Dan Shimensky, Steve Short, Jason Miller, Felipe Eichenberger, & the rest of the Denver medical team. The Nuggets did not lose a single man game to injury or illness during their entire playoff run!They also finished the regular season with the 6th fewest games lost.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I stayed relatively quiet this NBA postseason as the big bad injury bug stayed away from the final few rounds. Overall the numbers of games lost to injury or illness per the number of playoff games played (2.62) was the lowest it’s been since the 2018-19 season.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Carmelo Anthony's durability remains one of his most overlooked traits. Melo finishes his career with over 100 recorded injuries or illnesses, including multiple surgeries on his L knee, elbow surgery, a broken hand, bilateral shoulder labrum tears, & at least 15 ankle sprains.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Despite this laundry list of injuries, he missed just 141 games due to injury over his 19 seasons in the NBA (~7.4 games lost per season played).  He’s finishes his career 23rd all-time in regular season minutes played and 28th all-time in total minutes played. #STAYME7O

text: The injuries in the NBA today (Giannis, Herro, and Ja) are so frustrating because they are difficult to predict and prevent. Hate to see it happen.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Ja Morant: His fall involved a FOOSH (fall on an outstretched hand). This mechanism of injury is the most common for hand and wrist injuries, including sprains and fractures. Hope he’s ok.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Anthony Davis: Stingers are nerve-related injuries that involve the brachial plexus, a bundle of nerves that extend from the neck to the shoulder. They can be very painful but are often transient. They rarely result in time lost in the NBA.

text: I've been quiet since Friday as I dealt w/ the aftermath of the tornado that ripped through Little Rock and Central Arkansas. My family avoided most of the damage but my poor mother-in-law was at work & stuck in the middle of it. Her car is totaled but she's physically ok.

author: InStreetClothes
text: The community has really rallied around one another and the support from across the city has been amazing.  If you can, please donate to Little Rock Cares to help with the tornado relief. https://t.co/NKMKfy7amd

text: For the record, I’m aware the team has not confirmed Durant’s injury as a Grade 2 ankle sprain. The reason for my update was to provide context to the reports that a Grade 2 sprain is feared to have occurred.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I’ll be ok if it’s like this all season https://t.co/FRDJorIvZf

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Naz Reid: MIN confirms his injury is a scaphoid fracture. The scaphoid is a cashew-shaped carpal bone located at the base of the thumb. It is a key contributor to motion at the wrist. Other players to suffer the injury include Bradley Beal & former Minnesota G Kevin Martin.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Surgery is often utilized as blood flow to the area is limited. The average time lost for in-season scaphoid fractures in the NBA is ~ 9 weeks.

author: InStreetClothes
text: For more details on the injury, here is the piece I wrote when Beal suffered his scaphoid fracture in 2014. https://t.co/mX2OrxZGPN

author: InStreetClothes
text: I'll be closely watching this development. One of the unrated components of Sacramento's success this season is the health of the squad and the hard work of their medical team.

author: InStreetClothes
text: *underrated

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Kevin Durant: A Grade 2 sprain is also known as a partial or incomplete tear. Other players to sustain G2 ankle sprains includes Mike Conley, LaMelo Ball, Ja Morant, and Trae Young. Historically, the average time lost is ~7 games (~19 days). 1/2

author: InStreetClothes
text: However, time lost for G2 ankle sprains sustained this season has been longer. The average time lost this year comes in at ~15 games (~7 weeks). This doesn’t include Portland’s Justise Winslow who has not played since late December. 2/2

text: Re: Jose Alvarado: A stress reaction is a precursor to a stress fracture. Halting stress and allowing the body’s natural remodeling to catch back up can prevent a fracture from developing. However, any underlying causes must also be addressed.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Anfernee Simons: A G2 ankle sprain means there was partial tearing of the involved ligament(s). Historically the average time lost had been ~3 weeks (~9.7 games). Players to sustain a comparable injury include Ja Morant, Kyle Lowry, and Kevin Durant. 1/2

text: However, this season players who have suffered G2 ankle sprains have missed closer to 6 weeks (~15 games), including LaMelo Ball, Chris Duarte, and Precious Achiuwa. 2/2

author: InStreetClothes
text: Anthony Davis Injury News: The retina is the light-sensitive layer of nerve tissue located at the back of the eye that helps focus and relay information to the brain, which then helps form an individual's vision. The retina can be "bruised". tear, or become detached.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Multiple NBA players have suffered retina injuries, including Dirk Nowitzki who bruised his right retina in 2006. Players to endure retina tears or detached retinas include Matt Barnes, DJ Mbenga, &, most famously, Amar'e Stoudemire. Fortunately surgery has a high success rate.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Jaren Jackson Jr. Injury Update: The term turf toe is used to describe a sprain of the 1st metatarsophalangeal (MTP) joint of the big toe. Surgery is often needed when the plantar plate ruptures. Others to suffer a similar injury include Blake Griffin & Myles Turner. Average lost time for NBA cases that needed surgery is ~3 months.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I previously examined turf toe injuries when Jackson’s former teammate Desmond Bane suffered a G2 big toe sprain in 2022. https://t.co/61TUR4rZA3

author: InStreetClothes
text: I hope Josh Corbeil, Carl Eaton, & the rest of the Indy medical staff gets their flowers after tonight. The group has been together for along time & routinely finishes as a top ranked unit in the NBA. Since 2005, they rank as the 9th best medical staff, recording 6 top-5 & 8 top-10 regular season finishes. On to Game 7!

author: InStreetClothes
text: I had a student athletic trainer tell me our Game Ready looks like a Ghostbuster’s Ghost Trap and now I’m just walking around the athletic training room quoting the movie https://t.co/Wfgamn05UB

author: InStreetClothes
text: Interested to hear the results of Haliburton's MRI. I recorded 23 injuries labeled calf strains in the NBA during the regular season. Only one case did not result in time lost with the quickest turnaround being 3 days (1 game lost).

author: InStreetClothes
text: For those looking for more information on Maddy Siegrist, check out my prior breakdown of the injury following Kobe’s tibial plateau fracture: https://t.co/OWC2sViGNV

author: InStreetClothes
text: Tibial plateau fractures are relatively uncommon but several notable basketball players, including Kobe Bryant and teammate Paige Bueckers, have suffered the injury. Average time lost for cases in the NBA is ~10 weeks.

author: InStreetClothes
text: My latest Fantasy Baseball Injury Report on @RotoWire: Zebby Matthews Out With Shoulder Strain https://t.co/SeFRrV0lLl

author: InStreetClothes
text: Anytime I see a hard foul in the playoffs I think of Stackhouse fouling Shaq in the 2006 Finals. Still salty Stack got suspended.

author: InStreetClothes
text: All the post GSW accomplishments Kevin Durant mentioned are even more impressive considering it was AFTER he tore his Achilles. He’s an outlier for what it means to come back from that injury and I hope Jayson Tatum joins him

author: InStreetClothes
text: New on InStreetClothes: Understanding Jaylen Brown's Knee Debridement: https://t.co/neZqvvHwrW

author: InStreetClothes
text: Debridement suggests this is most likely a partial meniscectomy. Meniscus injuries are all about location, meaning Brown’s problem was likely unrepairable.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Darius Garland Update: Cleveland announced their All-Star guard required surgery on his previously sprained big toe. Other players to undergo similar procedures include Devin Harris, Blake Griffin, & Jared Dudley. Based on these cases, a return by training camp seems realistic.

author: InStreetClothes
text: My latest Fantasy Baseball Injury Report for @RotoWire: Twins Rotation Takes Hit https://t.co/jXBghH72y7

author: InStreetClothes
text: Zach Edey's left ankle issues date back to last year's Summer League & carried over into the season. He missed 12 games following a sprain in November & another late in the year with left ankle soreness. His ligament(s) were clearly pushed past their yield point, thus surgery.

author: InStreetClothes
text: 🏒 also fun

text: 🏀 is indeed fun

text:
More NBA injury news: According to @ramonashelburne Jaylen Brown played through a partial meniscus tear. Hard to pinpoint exactly when it occurred.

The first signs of a knee issue surfaced in February when he missed time w/ knee swelling. He missed 12 total games from that point forward w/ what was described as pain or impingement.

author: InStreetClothes
text: The latest update on Aaron Gordon is sadly a big one. A Grade 2 strain is often referred to as a partial or incomplete tear. Average time lost for G2 hamstring strains in the NBA is ~31 days (11.2 games). Gordon’s 2020 season also ended early following a strain of the same hammy.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Severity of the strain will ultimately dictate how much time Steph Curry potentially misses. Average time lost for confirmed G1 strain is ~10 days. That jumps to ~31 days for G2 strains. Time lost for nondescript strains is ~12 days.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I have recorded 125 various injury entries for Steph Curry in his NBA career. This will be the first hamstring-related injury of note.

author: InStreetClothes
text: LeBron James injury news: Grade 2 sprains are also known as partial or incomplete tears. Surgery isn’t often warranted, especially if the medial meniscus is unaffected. Other players to suffer G2 MCL sprains include Kevin Durant, Marc Gasol, & SGA w/ the injury carrying in an average time lost of ~41 days (~21 games)

author: InStreetClothes
text: Injury info on Damian Lillard: The average time lost for qualifying NBA players following an Achilles tear is ~10 months. Dame is 54 days older than Kobe was when he tore his Achilles. Bryant was back in action in 240 days (~7.9 months)

author: InStreetClothes
text: The integrity of the Achilles can be tested by a medical professional using a simple but highly accurate special test known as the Thompson test. MRIs are often needed just for confirmation. Hate this for Dame.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I launched https://t.co/eAm93BKSY6 & started counting injuries on a daily basis 11 years ago & it still catches me off guard when people cite or reference my work. Thanks to @WindhorstESPN for the shoutout on the pod today

author: InStreetClothes
text: Injury update on Jimmy Butler: A glute contusion is an ideal outcome for the Warriors forward & one he is familiar with. Butler suffered a glute contusion during the 2023 playoffs & never missed a game. The average time lost for all other glute contusions is 5.2 days (~1.0 game).

author: InStreetClothes
text: Odd injury note on Jimmy Butler & pelvic contusions: No team in the ISC injury database has suffered more pelvic contusions than Golden State. Other notable names on the list include Andrew Bogut, Draymond, & Steph Curry and Kuminga from earlier this season.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Since the 2005-06 season, the average time lost for pelvic contusions league wide is 6.9 days (~2.1 games).  Butler's impending  MRI will provide more context and hopefully nothing more significant has occurred.

author: InStreetClothes
text: UPDATE: Jayson Tatum's wrist injury is being described as a right distal radius bone bruise. Translation: The wrist end (distal) of the forearm bone on his thumb side (radius) has been damaged. The average time lost for nondescript wrist bone contusions is 2.6 days (~0.6 game).

author: InStreetClothes
text: However, the term bruise can be misleading. The body’s natural healing response doesn't differentiate between a bone bruise & a fracture, repairing both in a similar fashion. This takes time & symptoms can linger.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Denver Nuggets owner Josh Kroenke: “While the timing of this decision is unfortunate, as Coach Malone helped build the foundation of our now championship level program, it is a necessary step to allow us to compete at the highest level right now. author: ShamsCharania
text: Twelve-time All-Star Chris Paul has agreed to a deal with the Los Angeles Clippers, CAA's Steven Heumann, Ty Sullivan and Jessica Holtz told ESPN. Paul had multiple suitors, but chose the contending Clippers and their shared history in L.A. for his likely final, 21st NBA season. https://t.co/qC640MFFeI

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Los Angeles Lakers have waived guard Jordan Goodwin, sources tell ESPN. Goodwin emerged as a key rotation piece for JJ Redick late last season, playing 29 games and four playoff contests. Goodwin and Shake Milton were released to clear space for arrival of Marcus Smart.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Memphis Grizzlies are signing forward PJ Hall to a two-way NBA contract, agent Matt Bollero of ProMondo Sports tells ESPN. Hall, who played 19 games for the Nuggets last season, averaged 24.2 points and 14.7 rebounds on 65.5% shooting per-36 minutes in summer league.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Denver Nuggets are signing guard Curtis Jones to a two-way NBA contract, agent Austin Walton of NEXT Sports tells ESPN. After going undrafted out of Iowa State, Jones had a stellar summer league for the Nuggets, averaging 15 points, 4.4 rebounds and 3.8 assists on 47% from 3.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Los Angeles Lakers have waived guard Shake Milton, sources tell ESPN. Milton's $3 million contract for next season would have become fully guaranteed today. Lakers are clearing space for signing of Marcus Smart.

author: ShamsCharania
text: ESPN story on Marcus Smart intending to join the Los Angeles Lakers after a buyout with the Washington Wizards -- and after playoff berths in all of his nine seasons with LA's rival Boston Celtics: https://t.co/2MASjuBXoK

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Marcus Smart has agreed to a contract buyout with the Washington Wizards and intends to sign a two-year, $11 million deal with the Los Angeles Lakers after clearing waivers, sources tell ESPN. A return to a grand stage for the 2022 NBA Defensive Player of the Year. https://t.co/8g9Bxzz11E

author: ShamsCharania
text: Japanese guard Yuki Kawamura has agreed to a two-way NBA deal with the Chicago Bulls, sources tell ESPN. Bulls finalized the deal with Kawamura's agents at Wasserman to sign the 5-foot-8 point guard amid a strong summer league. https://t.co/pBYWIwxXz3

author: ShamsCharania
text: Pelicans forward/center Derik Queen underwent surgery to repair a torn scapholunate ligament in his left wrist and will be re-evaluated in 12 weeks.

author: ShamsCharania
text: On the biggest reason Damian Lillard returned to Portland for @SportsCenter at Night: https://t.co/aQVIl6WIrm

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sources: Damian Lillard reaches 3-year, $42M deal to return to Trail Blazers - via ESPN https://t.co/2VjHAPK9Cw

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Los Angeles Lakers plan to sign 7-footer Christian Koloko and forward Chris Manon on two-way NBA contracts, sources tell ESPN. Manon, undrafted out of Vanderbilt, played for the Warriors in California and Las Vegas summer leagues. Koloko played 37 games for L.A. last season.

author: ShamsCharania
text: This is a continuation of the Lakers development plan with Koloko, who had other interested teams as well.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Smart, a three-time All-Defense first team guard, will have a player option on his new Lakers deal to enter a more flush 2026 free agency, sources said. Point of attack defender was a position of need for L.A. as well -- with Luka Doncic recruiting and reaching out to Smart.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Lakers, Phoenix Suns and Milwaukee Bucks all seriously pursued Smart, with positive conversations with personnel from all three teams after he and his agent Jason Glushon received permission to explore options from the Wizards, sources said.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
Other random NBA injury notes:

1. 3 Players missed all 82 games (Bey, Topic, & Holmes)

2. The bottom 8 teams all set franchise highs for the inactive list era

3. The cumulative total for games lost to injury or illness since 2005-06 surpassed 100,000

author: InStreetClothes
text: The 5 healthiest teams during the regular season were Minnesota, Houston, Sacramento, Golden State with Phoenix & Milwaukee tying for 5th. Rounding out the bottom 5 were Philly, Brooklyn, Charlotte, New Orleans, & Dallas.

author: InStreetClothes
text: My initial total for games lost to injury or illness in the NBA this season comes in at 6779, the second highest total since 2005. If games lost to COVID-19 or healthy and safety protocols are excluded, it is the highest total in my database.

text: Following last night's games, the total games lost to injury or illness in the NBA surpassed the 6,000 mark for just the second time since the 2005-06 season. The only other time this has occurred was during the 2021-22 season that was ravaged by the Omicron variant of COVID-19.

Along with the Bucks’ medical staff, our priorities are to protect my health and safety. As much as I love basketball, I need to be there for my kids and my family. I’m grateful the Bucks acted quickly on this. They’ve been supportive and proactive throughout this process. I look forward to moving past this and continuing my career.”

author: ShamsCharania
text:
Portland traded Damian Lillard for Jrue Holiday, Toumani Camara, assets in 2023 – then Holiday to Boston for Robert Williams III, Malcolm Brogdon, assets (one led to Deni Avdija).

Now, Blazers have Lillard and Holiday, plus Avdija, Williams, Camara, a 2029 first, two MIL swaps.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Lillard will use the 2025-26 season to rehabilitate a torn Achilles tendon, but a return to the franchise and Portland where his family and kids reside were of the ultimate importance. He also had multiple mid-level exception and minimum offers from NBA contenders.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Lillard and the Trail Blazers both deeply cared about the comeback in recent weeks – with multiple meetings among the Portland franchise icon, general manager Joe Cronin and head coach Chauncey Billups to bond together and move forward united on a new deal.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Lillard now will have a 2025-26 set salary of $70M between his Portland and Milwaukee deals, and a salary of $141M over the next two years ahead of an opt-out in 2027. Blazers officials and Aaron Goodwin of Goodwin Sports Management are finalizing terms this week.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Nine-time NBA All-Star Damian Lillard is finalizing a three-year, $42 million contract to return to the Portland Trail Blazers, sources tell ESPN. Deal is expected to include a player option in 2027-28 and a no-trade clause. A storybook reunion home for the 35-year-old. https://t.co/mm1uUtMgO6

author: ShamsCharania

text: Livingston's progress this month in summer league for the Bucks helps him land a new deal -- 20 points and 5.3 rebounds per game while shooting 50% from the field and 37.5% from 3.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Milwaukee Bucks are re-signing forward Chris Livingston on a fully guaranteed one-year, $2.3 million deal, Rich Paul and Brandon Cavanaugh of Klutch Sports tell ESPN. Livingston, the 58th pick in the 2023 NBA draft, receives a third consecutive year on a guaranteed contract. https://t.co/yRQHzrMZxZ

author: ShamsCharania
text: Full ESPN story on three-time All-Star Bradley Beal agreeing to a contract buyout with the Phoenix Suns to join the Los Angeles Clippers after extensive meetings with a host of suitors: https://t.co/j1C8568BQc

author: ShamsCharania
text: This now gives the Suns increased team-building flexibility by taking them out of the first and second aprons, providing access to more tradeable draft picks in the future, and opening up part of the mid-level exception to utilize.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Beal became extremely excited about the route to part ways after meeting with multiple interested suitors, and Bartelstein then moved forward with the Suns on completing the release Wednesday, opening the path for Beal to start a new chapter in LA.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The crux of the decision for Beal and his representation was finding the best basketball situation first and foremost once he was granted permission by the Suns to speak to interested suitors around the NBA, and Bartelstein led an exhaustive process over the last few weeks.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Three-time NBA All-Star Bradley Beal has agreed to a contract buyout with the Phoenix Suns and plans to join the Los Angeles Clippers on a two-year, $11 million deal with a player option after clearing waivers, Mark Bartelstein of @PrioritySports told ESPN. https://t.co/gxZB0ObSms

author: ShamsCharania
text: ESPN story on the Phoenix Suns and Devin Booker reaching historic $145 million extension that now keeps the franchise's all-time leading scorer through 2030: https://t.co/mrHQznCMXe

author: ShamsCharania
text: Booker, the Suns No. 13 overall pick in the 2015 Draft, has played all 10 NBA seasons in Phoenix and now lands his third contract extension with the franchise. He doubles down again on his loyalty to the Suns – and wanting to win there – in an era of frequent player movement.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Booker and owner Mat Ishbia met in Las Vegas tonight to finalize the contract, which cements Booker’s commitment to the Suns vision for the future and him as the franchise’s leader moving forward. Booker now has five years and $316 million total on his Suns deal.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Phoenix Suns superstar Devin Booker has agreed to a two-year, $145 million maximum contract extension with the franchise through the 2029-30 season, the highest annual extension salary in NBA history, CAA’s Jessica Holtz and Melvin Booker told ESPN. https://t.co/A5U5VPlSgx

author: InStreetClothes
text: After Wemby's DVT in late February, Dame Lillard becomes the latest NBA player to be diagnosed with a blood clot, joining a list that includes Ausar Thompson, Tyreke Evans, Chris Bosh, and Brandon Ingram.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Lillard's DVT is in his lower extremity and determining the cause of the clot will be important for his long-term health. He has been placed on blood-thinners but those obviously make him a risk for increased bleeding and often result in considerable time lost.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I previously discussed DVTs when Ingram was diagnosed back in 2019. https://t.co/YduNYU1pht

author: ShamsCharania
text: OKC's Chet Holmgren agrees to rookie max extension - via ESPN https://t.co/DEyO0xzoU2

author: ShamsCharania
text: After missing three months during the season, Holmgren returned in February and came back stronger to help lead OKC and its young core to the NBA title. The Thunder will now move toward locking in All-NBA superstar Jalen Williams, who has momentum in his rookie extension talks.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Breaking: Oklahoma City Thunder star and NBA champion Chet Holmgren has agreed to a fully guaranteed five-year maximum rookie contract extension that could reach $250 million, agent Bill Duffy of WME Basketball told ESPN. https://t.co/PsdxZq275C

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sources: Spurs acquire Kelly Olynyk in deal with Wizards - via ESPN https://t.co/3NeXdWdB8c

author: ShamsCharania
text: The deal gives the Spurs another stretch big after the free agent signing of Luke Kornet, and Washington receives two more young players as the Wizards continue to add some talent this offseason with potential for increased opportunity along with an expected later second-rounder.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Washington Wizards are trading Kelly Olynyk to the San Antonio Spurs for Malaki Branham, Blake Wesley and a 2026 second-round pick (least favorable of Dallas, Philadelphia, Oklahoma City), sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/JWiOF2nzq2

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Oklahoma City Thunder are re-signing 7-footer Branden Carlson to a new two-way NBA contract, Ross Aroyo of @PrioritySports tells ESPN. Carlson played 32 games for the Thunder last season and had a standout campaign for the OKC Blue.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Summer of SGA: MVP award, league scoring title, an NBA championship, Finals MVP, a $285 million super max extension, first signature shoe release ... and now Shai Gilgeous-Alexander will grace the new cover of NBA 2K26, per sources.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Dallas Mavericks All-Star Anthony Davis underwent a procedure to repair a detached retina that he suffered during the season, sources tell ESPN. Davis played through multiple hits to the face last year. He is expected to be healthy for next training camp. https://t.co/Yz8vxBlp06

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent F Isaiah Livers will sign a two-way NBA contract with the Phoenix Suns, Andy Shiffman and Mark Bartelstein of @PrioritySports tell ESPN. Livers missed all of last season due to hip surgery but has made a full recovery and now restarts career for his fourth NBA season.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Paolo Banchero, Magic agree to five-year rookie max extension - via ESPN https://t.co/PJ0O0MqfzO

author: ShamsCharania
text: This cements the Magic core of Banchero, Franz Wagner and Jalen Suggs now all under contract for the next five years.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Breaking: Orlando Magic star Paolo Banchero has agreed to a five-year maximum rookie contract extension that could reach $287 million, Mike Miller of LIFT Sports Management tells ESPN. Deal includes a player option; the first for a rookie max since 2021 (Luka Doncic, Trae Young). https://t.co/bwnCrJbnmu

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Kyle Lowry has agreed to a one-year deal to return to the Philadelphia 76ers, Mark Bartelstein of @PrioritySports tells ESPN. The 2019 champion is back for his 20th NBA season – and a third consecutive year with his hometown 76ers. https://t.co/6Wnw3S9TT3

author: ShamsCharania
text: Full ESPN story on the Clippers, Heat, Jazz three-team trade that sends Norman Powell to Miami and John Collins to L.A.: https://t.co/mi2Pdc5JPk

author: ShamsCharania
text: Miami is acquiring a major scoring punch in Powell while the Clippers find a dynamic lob threat. Both Powell and Collins are coming off strong seasons. Utah has turned Collins' expiring deal into an asset in the form of a second-rounder in return.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: The Clippers, Jazz and Heat have agreed to a trade that sends Norman Powell to Miami, John Collins to Los Angeles, and Kevin Love, Kyle Anderson and a 2027 Clippers second-round pick to the Jazz, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/o0FkV0o2l8

author: ShamsCharania
text: Ryan Rollins agrees to 3-year deal to return to Bucks - via ESPN https://t.co/1CKM9XyQQX

author: ShamsCharania
text: Rollins, a 2022 second-rounder, joined the Bucks on a two-way contract in Feb. 2024 and spent most of 2024-25 on a two-way before receiving a standard deal in March. He opted for a rest of season contract, became an unrestricted free agent and now is rewarded with a $12M deal.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent guard Ryan Rollins has agreed to a three-year, $12 million deal to return to the Milwaukee Bucks, with a player option in the third season, agents Mike Silverman and Brandon Grier of Equity Sports tell ESPN. https://t.co/pUIflaivzw

text: Re: Jaren Jackson Jr.: A Grade 2 sprain is also known as a partial or incomplete tear. Multiple players have sustained G2 ankle sprains in recent seasons, include teammate Ja Morant. The average time lost for injuries of this severity is ~ 3 weeks.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Jrue Holiday: Mallet finger is an injury to the tendon that helps straighten the DIP joint (finger tip). Players have played with the injury while others have needed surgery. It often depends on the severity of tendon damage & the involved digit.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
Re: Daniel Gafford: A G3 MCL sprain is considered a complete tear. Surgery isn’t required, especially if meniscus involvement is minimal. Average time lost for non-surgical cases in the NBA is 26 games (60 days).

Included on this list is current Mavs assistant coach Jared Dudley who missed 34 games in the 2020-21 season.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Victor Wembanyama: A deep vein thrombosis (DVT) is a clot that develops in one of the major veins of the body, usually in the lower extremity. Brandon Ingram also developed a DVT in his shoulder, missing the final 19 games of the 2018-19 season.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I previously discussed DVTs following Ingram's case, including possible contributing factors and long-term concerns: https://t.co/YduNYU1pht

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Daniel Gafford: His right knee was forced into hyperextension which resulted in a knee sprain according to the Mavs. The involved ligament and degree of sprain will dictate treatment options and time lost. A low-grade sprain would likely be a best case scenario.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I’m very tired of discussing injuries about my hometown team

author: InStreetClothes
text: Happy for Kyrie but I’m clearly still feeling the effects of the last 9 days because man did my heart skip a beat and fear the worst when I got a notification with his name in it.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Sent this out days before the trade. With surgery being discussed as a possible option, it’s seems more and more likely AD has a core muscle injury (CMI). Surgery comes with a high success rate but would likely end his season.

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @Baxter: Today, Nate Robinson underwent surgery for a kidney transplant from a live donor.  The surgery was a success. My quick story: h…

author: InStreetClothes
text: By my account there were 14 NBA players traded this season while also appearing on the injury report. Players like Josh Richardson and James Wiseman have already been waived while both teams in the Luka-AD swap await the debuts of their respective acquisitions.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Cody Martin, like his twin brother Caleb, changes team with an injury designation. Martin has missed the last seven games with what was initially called core tightness but has since been changed to a sports hernia.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Caleb Martin is one of 11 injured players to be traded (so far) this season. He's already missed 12 games with a hip sprain and appears on track to miss more time. Interested to see if we ever find out what resulted in the added compensation.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Oh joy another player currently on the injured list has been traded...

author: InStreetClothes
text: Not that anyone cares but when an injured player gets traded it’s a massive headache for me and my injury database. So of course the Luka trade involves not 1 but 3 injured players changing squads.

author: InStreetClothes
text: First job I had as a certified athletic trainer was working with the Mavs Hoop Camps. Those coaches are amazing people.

author: InStreetClothes

author: InStreetClothes
text:
2024-25 NBA Week 16 Injury Report
W16 Games Lost to Injury/Illness: 268
Total Games Lost for Season: 4040

W16 Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 15
Total Games Lost to Rest/Injury Management: 123

Notable new injury:
Anthony Davis: Adductor strain

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Anthony Davis: The adductor muscles are more commonly known as the groin. A multi-week absence suggests a more moderate strain. Worth noting AD has a history of low-grade left adductor strains dating back to his time in New Orleans. He has also been nursing an abdominal strain that could be connected to this issue. According to @TheSteinLine Dallas is still exploring treatment options.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sources: Grizzlies trading center Jay Huff to Pacers - via ESPN https://t.co/i4H0HN0SXV

author: ShamsCharania
text: Rockets trade Cam Whitmore to Wizards, sources say - via ESPN https://t.co/5pjYhbDH09

author: ShamsCharania
text: After departure of Myles Turner, Pacers trade for the 7-foot-1 Huff, who averaged 6.9 points, 2 rebounds and nearly 1 block in 11.7 minutes per night. He shot 41% from 3-point range last season, playing in 64 games after just a total of 31 contests in his first three seasons.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent center Jock Landale has agreed to a deal with the Memphis Grizzlies, sources tell ESPN. Landale solidifies the Grizzlies frontcourt as the team and his agent, Sammy Wloszczowski of SIG Sports, reach terms.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Memphis Grizzlies are trading center Jay Huff to the Indiana Pacers for one second-round pick and one second-round pick swap, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Rockets worked with Whitmore, the No. 20 pick in 2023, and his reps at WME Basketball over the last few weeks on a new home. Whitmore has averaged 10.8 points over two years -- last season scoring 0.46 points per touch, 4th-best among players to record 1,000 touches.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Houston Rockets are trading Cam Whitmore to the Washington Wizards for two second-round picks, sources tell ESPN. The deal gives Whitmore a tremendous opportunity for an increased role as he turns 21 on Tuesday and returns to the DMV area. https://t.co/8BaBsVxjN2

author: ShamsCharania
text: Wagner, who sustained ACL tear in December, was averaging a career high 12.9 points and shooting a career-best 36% from 3 before injury. Through his 30 games, Wagner had emerged as a Sixth Man of the Year candidate and led NBA in PPG among players to average under 20 minutes.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent forward/center Moe Wagner has agreed to a one-year, $5 million deal to return to the Orlando Magic, sources tell ESPN. Wagner's agent, Jason Glushon, reached the new contract with Magic executives on Friday. https://t.co/YInqnHBFef

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent forward Jabari Walker has agreed to a two-way NBA deal with the Philadelphia 76ers, source tells ESPN. Walker spent his first three NBA seasons in Portland, appearing in 188 games.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Hayes emerged as the Lakers starting center last season and shot a career high 72.2% from the field and finished top-10 in field goal percentage allowed as contesting defender on layups and dunks among players to contest 250+ shots. Now backs up new Lakers big man Deandre Ayton.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent center Jaxson Hayes has agreed on a one-year deal to return to the Los Angeles Lakers, sources tell ESPN. Hayes' agents, Bill Duffy and Marlon Harrison of WME Basketball, finalized a contract with Lakers president Rob Pelinka on Thursday. https://t.co/fZOeqVyo9u

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Houston Rockets are waiving center Jock Landale ahead of his July 7 guarantee date, sources tell ESPN. Landale is expected to sign with his preferred destination upon clearing waivers.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Dallas Mavericks assistant Jared Dudley is finalizing a deal to become the top assistant coach for the Denver Nuggets under David Adelman, Andy Miller of Klutch Sports tells ESPN. Dudley has been on Mavs' staff since 2021 after a 14-year NBA career. https://t.co/sA5gN2yp8h

author: ShamsCharania
text: Dallas Mavericks player development coach God Shammgod has agreed to join the Orlando Magic as an assistant coach, Andy Miller of Klutch Sports tells ESPN. Shammgod has worked for the Mavericks since 2019 and now receives a larger role in Orlando.

text: Multiple obstacles in the way to make a drastic change at the deadline, Phoenix Suns were always prepared to venture into second half of season with the core roster in place. With futures no longer in doubt for time being, the internal hope is improved play.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Sources: Jimmy Butler’s camp has repeatedly told Heat he’s in shape, healthy and ready to continue his career and move past this immediately. Their messaging to Heat has been to negotiate best deal possible and once in red zone, if that team is granted permission by MIA to speak with Butler’s rep to discuss his longterm future, that dialogue would be welcomed. To date, no team has asked for permission.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: In light of major NBA movement recently, a few teams that are scheduled to travel on Feb. 6 of the trade deadline have adjusted itineraries after realizing the team would be in the air when the deadline passed. This is to prevent a potential awkward flight.

author: InStreetClothes
text: As I sit here trying to figure out how I’m going to explain the Luka trade to my Mavericks loving 9 y.o. and 13 y.o. in the morning, let me just tell you I’m for dang sure not going to film their reactions. Hope other parents take the same approach.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I just remembered AD is hurt right now too... SMH

author: InStreetClothes
text: Achilles tendon tears have actually been down over the past three seasons in the NBA. Unfortunately, this season we are seeing a big spike. Dejounte Murray is the fourth Achilles tear of the year, not including DaRon Holmes' injury in Summer League.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Just getting off work and seeing the Dejounte Murray injury. My guy @BrianSuttererMD does a fantastic job breaking down what is likely a serious Achilles injury.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Kudos to @ESefko for his story on Dante Exum and revealing the injury was a scaphoid fracture. I'm going to need him to do the same for Kleber's foot. https://t.co/w862vW01Ut

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Anthony Davis: The average time lost for nondescript abdominal strains is 10.0 days (~3.2 games). If the injury is more complex (think sports hernia or core muscle tear) than the time lost drastically increases.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Maxi Kleber: Like with Lively, the involved bone and location of the fracture will determine treatment options and time lost. Kleber adds another serious injury to a growing list of ailments that includes a pinkie toe dislocation, torn hamstring, & G3 AC sprain.

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @iztok_franko: My column on Lively’s injury: what it means in the short term, what the trade deadline might reveal, Luka’s return timeli…

author: InStreetClothes
text: Hoping to hear what bone Lively fractured to provide more insight. A fifth metatarsal fracture seems likely considering how he was injured but waiting for confirmation.

author: InStreetClothes
text: https://t.co/wOubaJKbWQ

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Brandon Miller: The scapholunate ligament is the most frequently sprained carpal ligament. The majority of NBA players that have torn the ligament have ultimately needed surgery, including Jaylen Brown & Bradley Beal. Surgery is accompanied by a lengthy recovery.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Hearing Kyrie discuss the nuisances around his back injury is yet another reason why having a former player like Jared Dudley on a coaching staff is so valuable. Dudley managed a bulging lumbar disc during his playing career, ultimately undergoing a microdiscectomy.

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @_petethetrainer: First class move by the @Timberwolves to recognize a true pro, leader and all around great guy! Congrats Gregg 💪🏀⚕️@NB…

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Jalen Johnson: Johnson becomes the latest NBA player to sustain a significant shoulder labrum injury, joining the likes of Ja Morant, Pascal Siakam, & Jalen Brunson. While his season is over, the success rate of the surgery is high & he should be ready for next season.

author: InStreetClothes
text: I discussed the specifics around these types of injuries when Morant was injured.  https://t.co/Bmn1VqK1SR

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Herb Jones: Shoulder labrum injuries in the NBA are relatively common. Shaedon Sharpe, Julius Randle, & Ja Morant have sustained the injury in recent seasons. If the tear is small & the instability is minimal, rehab can improve the issue w/out the need for surgery.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
Surgery may be needed if the shoulder remains unstable but does come with a high success rate. I discussed the injury last season when Morant was injured. 

https://t.co/Bmn1VqK1SR

author: ShamsCharania
text: Ayton will sign a two-year deal with the Lakers, with a player option, sources tell ESPN.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Lakers find their starting center in Ayton, the 2018 No. 1 overall pick who is the only player in NBA history to average 15+ points and 60%+ shooting in the postseason. He has career averages of 16.4 points and 10.5 rebounds on 59% shooting over the last seven seasons.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Deandre Ayton has agreed to sign with the Los Angeles Lakers, sources tell ESPN. Between Portland and L.A., Ayton will earn $34 million next season. Agents Nima Namakian of Innovate Sports and Bill Duffy of WME Sports reached the deal with Lakers president Rob Pelinka. https://t.co/FUeNAkN19K

author: ShamsCharania
text: Reporting for @SportsCenter on the breaking news that the New York Knicks are set to hire Mike Brown as their new head coach: https://t.co/yTJS5Dk6Zz

author: ShamsCharania
text: Sources: Knicks expected to hire Mike Brown as next head coach - via ESPN https://t.co/Gjrz7QnXcy

author: ShamsCharania
text: Brown is a four-time champion as a top assistant in Golden State and San Antonio under Steve Kerr and Gregg Popovich and has coached an array of superstars across three decades coaching in the NBA. Most recently in 2022-23, Brown's Kings had the best-rated offense in the NBA.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Knicks president Leon Rose underwent a thorough process since the firing of Tom Thibdoeau a month ago. The Knicks requested permission for five NBA head coaches and were denied, then interviewed several available coaches and went through multi-round stages with candidates.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: The New York Knicks are expected to land on two-time NBA Coach of the Year Mike Brown as the franchise's next head coach, sources tell ESPN. https://t.co/LOXb74LFe4

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: NBA spokesman Mike Bass: “In March 2023, the NBA was alerted to unusual betting activity related to Terry Rozier’s performance in a game between Charlotte and New Orleans.  The league conductedan investigation and did not find a violation of NBA rules.  We are now aware of an investigation by the U.S. Attorney’s Office for the Eastern District of New York related to this matter and have been cooperating with that investigation.”

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: NBA statement: “The league conducted an investigation and did not find a violation of NBA rules. We are now aware of an investigation by the U.S. Attorney’s Office for the Eastern District of New York related to this matter and have been cooperating with that investigation.”

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Heat guard Terry Rozier is under investigation by federal prosecutors for potentially cooperating in an illegal sports betting scheme in 2023 while with the Hornets.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Sources: Kings star De’Aaron Fox is zeroed in on landing spot as franchise looks to possibly move him. Interested teams will likely be discouraged from trading for him being he’s set to become UFA in 2026. Fox’s unwillingness to sign extension has positioned the situation here.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: The Golden State Warriors announce they will retire Andre Iguodala’s No. 9 jersey on February 23 following the team’s game against the Dallas Mavericks. It will be the franchise’s seventh retired jersey.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Sources: Kaleb Canales — longtime NBA assistant and current associate head coach of G League’s Texas Legends — to be named head coach of Calgary Surge of Canadian Elite Basketball League. Season begins and runs through summer and he’ll be able to rejoin NBA staff next season. https://t.co/cYYnnZXuV0

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: In 2012 at the age of 33 when he was appointed interim head coach of the Portland Trail Blazers, Canales became the youngest active head coach in the NBA and the first Mexican-American coach in NBA history.

author: InStreetClothes
text: The current Mavs season is giving me real 2011 vibes. Mavs were sitting pretty until Dirk hurt his knee and Caron Butler went down. Team got healthy and went on a historic run. We will see if the current version can replicate the success.

author: InStreetClothes
text: It’s actually worse! The great @townbrad helped me out and noticed I missed one… I missed Daniel Gafford’s one game absence due to illness against the Knicks.

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @InStreetClothes: Kyrie Irving's absence tonight will be Dallas' 11th game lost due to illness this season, the highest total in the NBA…

author: InStreetClothes
text: Kyrie Irving's absence tonight will be Dallas' 11th game lost due to illness this season, the highest total in the NBA. 6 Mavs players have missed at least one game. Milwaukee is a close second with 10 games lost.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Rockets have been one of the healthier teams in the league this season. Surgery suggests the involved bone is displaced. Interested to see if we find out which bone (metacarpal?) is involved. Comparable to Larry Nance Jr.’s recent injury.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Larry Nance Jr.: This marks the second time in his career Nance has sustained a 4th metacarpal fracture. He broke his left hand in 2021 & missed 12 games after surgery. Average time lost for the injury is 14.4 games (~34.25 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Ja Morant: The average time lost for nondescript or low-grade in-season AC sprains is 12.4 days (~4.3 games). More info on his latest issue including why this is different from last year's injury here: https://t.co/FTTfQItV99

author: InStreetClothes
text: I’ve never met @Jonathan_Feigen personally but he has always been fantastic at reporting injuries while also supporting my work. Congrats on retirement.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Luka Doncic: There’s a lot of variability in calf strains as the calf is a muscle complex made up of multiple muscles. The pending MRI will help determine the muscle involved & severity. All signs point to this being a more moderate strain. Average time lost for a Grade 2 strain is 15 games (~34 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Kyrie Irving: Disc-issues can be difficult to navigate and are often accompanied by a lengthy recovery. The average time lost for in-season disc herniations that do not require surgery is 28.7 days (~12 games). (1/2)

author: InStreetClothes
text:
Read more here as I breakdown the specifics of Irving's bulging disc and how it compares to a jelly donut. (2/2)
https://t.co/HznLf8aJ5h

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Jared McCain: As Sixers fans are all too aware of, treatment options for meniscus tears are dictated by location of the tear. For a true repair to be possible, the damage has to occur to a specific region of the disc. Otherwise a meniscectomy (removal) may be the only option.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
I’ve covered lateral meniscus tears multiple times on the site including in 2019 when Zion sustained the injury.
https://t.co/OvyP3ijA1n

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Raptors and Poeltl's agents, Michael Tellem and Sam Goldfeder of Excel Sports, discussed several frameworks of a deal such as opt-out-and-extend -- but the sides land on an opt-in-and-extend, giving Toronto flexibility in the next two seasons.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Toronto Raptors center Jakob Poeltl has agreed on a four-year, $104 million contract extension with the franchise through 2029-30, sources tell ESPN. Poeltl will pick up his 2026-27 player option at $19.5M and add three additional years to his deal. https://t.co/wBHnoF5vUV

author: ShamsCharania
text: Raptors present Mamukelashvili with a larger opportunity in the frontcourt to break through in the NBA – as he has displayed glimpses such as a 34-point game in San Antonio.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent F/C Sandro Mamukelashvili has agreed to a two-year, $5.5 million deal with the Toronto Raptors, plus a second year player option, sources tell ESPN. George Roussakis and Mark Bartelstein of @PrioritySports negotiated the new deal with the Raptors. https://t.co/4GWqWrdVUm

author: ShamsCharania
text: Free agent center Jericho Sims has agreed to a two-year deal with the Milwaukee Bucks, including a player option in the second season, sources tell ESPN. author: ShamsCharania
text: Schroder used the momentum of his strong second half and playoff finish with the Pistons after being involved in the complicated Golden State-Miami Jimmy Butler trade to land this $45M deal in Sacramento.

author: ShamsCharania
text: ESPN story on the Milwaukee Bucks‘ stunning release of Damian Lillard to acquire free agent center Myles Turner on a four-year, $107 million deal: https://t.co/2JAItWVwJq

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Bucks found a creative path to waive and stretch Lillard – whose $113M will be stretched over the next five seasons – while leaving their future draft assets untouched. In a stunning turn of events, Myles Turner departs the Pacers to join the Bucks.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Just in: The Milwaukee Bucks are waiving Damian Lillard and stretching the remaining $113 million on his contract in order to acquire Myles Turner, sources tell ESPN. Lillard's two seasons in Milwaukee come to an end as he rehabilitates a torn Achilles tendon. https://t.co/eg1D1TMFM6

author: ShamsCharania
text: Bucks GM Jon Horst and CAA Co-Head of Basketball Austin Brown partnered on executing a massive deal in a market scarce of salary cap space during the opening days of free agency. Milwaukee retools aggressively around Giannis Antetokounmpo again.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Turner, the longest tenured Pacer, made it known he wished to remain in Indiana. Since the Game 7 exit, Turner’s reps pushed to get a deal done. Ultimately, Indiana’s aversion to the tax, which grew after Tyrese Haliburton’s injury, allowed Bucks to get the new franchise center.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Jordan Hawkins: The Pelicans forward has been diagnosed with a lumbar annular fissure. This injury occurs in a specific region of the vertebral disc known as the annulus fibrosus and can progress to a disc herniation if not properly treated.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Luka Doncic: Keyword is sprain, indicating the injury occurred to one of the many ligaments in the wrist. There is a high degree of variability in these types of injuries. However, the average time lost for nondescript in-season wrist sprains is 5.9 days (~ 2 games).

author: InStreetClothes
text: Following Tuesday’s games, the total games lost to injury or illness in the NBA passed the 1,000 mark. That didn’t happen until 11/28 last season.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: De'Anthony Melton: Surgery was always the most probable outcome. Very few ACL sprains have been treated non operatively. Hate to see him sidelined once again.

author: InStreetClothes
text:
RT @RotoWire: 🤕 Checking in on the status of Mike Evans, George Kittle, and more

It's #NFL Injury Analysis with @InStreetClothes 
https://…

author: InStreetClothes
text: The Thunder have lost 54 man games due to injury or illness through their first 13 games played. Last season they lost 53 games for the entire year. And they are still 11-2.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Immanuel Quickley: UCL sprains of the elbow are far less common in the NBA than in other sports, particularly baseball. Other players to suffer G2 (partial tear) sprains of the UCL include Jimmy Butler & Kurt Thomas. Average time lost is 11.7 games (26.5 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Joel Embiid: Sinus fractures are commonly associated with/ nasal & orbital fractures. The exact sinus broken &  subsequent treatment will dictate recovery. Courtney Lee suffered a sinus fracture during the 2009 playoffs & returned in 10 days, 8 days after surgery.

author: InStreetClothes
text: This marks the 3rd facial fracture of Embiid's career. He suffered a left orbital fracture in 2018 & a right orbital fracture in 2022. The 1st injury required surgery & he went on to miss 22 days (10 games). The 2022 injury cost him 2 postseason games over the course of 8 days.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Jeremy Sochan: The thumb is made up of two bones, the proximal & distal phalanges. The proximal is closer to the base of the thumb and is part of the MCP joint. The average time lost for thumb fractures that require surgery is ~21 games (~52 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text: I've had a few ?s about injuries to start the year. The number of games lost to injury in the NBA this season is higher than last season by roughly ~90 games. However, the injury rates remain nearly identical. Interested to see how this trend continues as the season progresses.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Steph: The peroneals (also known as the fibularis muscles) are primarily responsible for plantar flexion & eversion. They are often stretched when the ankle is forced inward. Other players to suffer the injury include Donovan Mitchell & Nick Young. Low-grade strains have an average time lost of 1.8 games (~6.75 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Steph Curry: The MRI will be crucial in determining severity of the sprain & the subsequent missed time. Hearing the word ”moderate” is concerning. Historically his R ankle has been more problematic but he has injured his L ankle at various points of his career, most recently in Dec. 2022.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Maxi Kleber: Hate hearing Kleber injured his hamstring, especially the right. He suffered a right semitendinosus (one of the 3 hamstring muscles) tendon tear in the 2022-23 season and missed 35 games. I hope it's nothing serious.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Brandon Miller: Not a ton of examples of glute strains in the NBA but there have been a few including Danilo Gallinari, Joe Harris, and Kevon Looney. The average time lost is 2.4 games (~7.3 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: James Wiseman: Hate to see him injured again. Season-ending injuries in Game 1 are relatively uncommon. It's happened 4 times since 2005, including Nene (ACL), Jeremy Lin (patella tendon tear), Julius Randle (leg), and, of course, Gordan Hayward's infamous leg fracture.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Just finished cataloguing all of last night's injuries in the NBA & had no trouble kicking off the rust. Hard to imagine it's been 11 years since I launched https://t.co/eAm93BKSY6 & started counting injuries on a daily basis. Thank you all for the support through the years.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Dejounte Murray: Time lost will be dictated by treatment options. If the fracture is non-displaced (like Hartenstein) & surgery is not needed then the average time lost is 15.6 games (35.2 days). If surgery is needed, the numbers go up slightly. (17.2 games, 40.5 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text: It's Day 1 & we already have something listed on the League's Injury Report I have never seen. Josh Richardson is listed as out w/ a heel enthesopathy. The term is used to describe a disorder at the attachment site of a tendon or ligament to a bone. Probably more common than we expect, I've just never seen it listed.

author: InStreetClothes

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @PodcastPShow: PG provides an update on his recent injury. https://t.co/ESdPrLxReh

author: InStreetClothes
text: One year after missing a league low 53 games to injury or illness, the Thunder will start the season without Isaiah Hartenstein & Nikola Topic. Kenrich Williams (knee) & Jaylin Williams (hamstring) are also working their way back from injuries of their own. Looks like OKC’s depth will be tested early.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Isaiah Hartenstein: Based on the description it seems likely he fractured one of his metacarpals. Because it is non-displaced, he will likely avoid surgery. The average time lost for hand fractures that do not need surgery is 15.6 games (35.2 days).

author: InStreetClothes
text: Paul George update: 76ers confirm the hyperextension resulted in a bone bruise of the knee. Location of the bruise is a major contributing factor to recovery but the average time lost for a knee bone contusion is 14.4 days. Fortunately it sounds like he avoided a serious injury.

author: InStreetClothes
text: RT @ginamizell: Chatted with Paul George in the postgame locker room. He had a sleeve on the knee but was walking and said he is “not too c…

author: InStreetClothes
text: Brian coming in and reiterating my point...

author: InStreetClothes
text: To be clear, a hyperextended knee can result in a wide variety of injuries including bone bruises. ligament sprains, or capsule injuries. Each injury carries its own recovery timeline. Like I said earlier, I expect PG-13 to undergo further testing to determine exact diagnosis.

author: InStreetClothes
text: Re: Paul George: The term hyperextension is more of a descriptor of what happened to the knee than an actual diagnosis. Expect more tests to come. Injuries labeled as "hyperextended knee" result in an average time lost of 6.4 days.

text: Los Angeles Lakers announced they have commissioned a statue of Pat Riley to join Lakers legends on Star Plaza outside of https://t.co/aSaOHCG67S Arena.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: “Pat is a Lakers icon,” said Jeanie Buss. “His professionalism, commitment to his craft and game preparation paved the way for the coaching we see across the league today. My dad recognized Pat’s obsession and ability to take talented players and coalesce them into a championship team. The style of basketball Pat and the Lakers created in the 80s is still the blueprint for the organization today: an entertaining and winning team.”

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: John David, one of the attorneys representing Shelton, issued me a statement: “We hope that our client’s lawsuit will serve as a wakeup call to the Clippers organization that their players are not just dollar values, but are humans requiring proper - and not hastened - health and recovery treatment for the careers and lives afterwards.”

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: The Clippers issued me a statement, disputing the claims: “Mr. Shelton’s claims were investigated and found to be without merit. We honored Mr. Shelton’s employment contract and paid him in full.  This lawsuit is a belated attempt to shake down the Clippers based on accusations that Mr. Shelton should know are false.”

author: ChrisBHaynes

author: InStreetClothes
text: RE: GG Jackson: 5th metatarsal injuries are relatively common in the NBA  & can occur in several ways & in multiple locations. The average time lost for in-season 5th metatarsal fractures in the NBA is ~42 games, though multiple players have missed substantially more time. 1/3

author: ChrisBHaynes

author: ChrisBHaynes
text:
Not my usual beat, but….

LBA (Little Basketball Association) News.

Sources say New York City Sky guard/retired streamer @KaiCenat left the arena with a right knee sprain after Monday nights game. He’ll likely be ready for the Finals tonight, but it’ll be a game-time decision. Kai Cenat’s legacy is on the line.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: This is a major hurdle cleared by Sacramento State. They have a new football stadium in the works, a huge NIL commitment of over $35 million and thanks to the Sacramento Kings, now have a world class basketball facility to warrant admittance into an FBS Conference.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Derrick Rose sent me a message on his retirement perspective: “Basketball was and always will be my first love. As a teenager, I had a goal of becoming an NBA player, and I achieved that. This isn’t a goodbye to the game I love; it’s a thank you.” https://t.co/QDefRlqquA

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Embiid to me on his UN participation: “I’ve never experienced UN week and it was very eye opening. I met so many leaders from Africa trying to create opportunities. I think of my own experience, and all the Africans in professional sports around the world, and how we can get all that influence working together.”

author: ChrisBHaynes
text:
I’m told Sixers star Joel Embiid is in New York for United Nation General Assembly week with focus of how business of sports can transform Africa financially. He will speak at two events today, including Earthshot Prize hosted by Prince William.

Monday night Bloomberg hosted an intimate dinner featuring Embiid, Toronto Raptors president Masai Ujiri, and a number of prominent leaders from Africa to discuss sports and Africa. Embiid went back to Cameroon this summer after the Paris Olympics.

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Sources: Former NBA head coach Earl Watson is joining the University of San Diego coaching staff where he will reunite with head coach Steve Lavin who coached him at UCLA. https://t.co/p0bAbfVOPa

author: ChrisBHaynes
text: Watson spent a total of 18 seasons in the NBA: 13 as a player and five as a coach. He was instrumental in the development of Devin Booker, OG Anunoby and Scottie Barnes. His AAU program, “Earl Watson Elite,” was a longtime fixture on the west coast with Josh Green of the Hornets being a notable alumni.

author: ShamsCharania
text: Philadelphia 76ers guard Eric Gordon is declining his $3.4 million player option to explore free agency, sources tell ESPN. A return to the 76ers is still possible.

author: ShamsCharania
text: The Philadelphia 76ers are declining guard Lonnie Walker IV’s team option worth $2.9 million, making him a free agent, sources tell ESPN. Walker averaged 12.3 points, 23.8 minutes and 35.4% 3-point shooting in 20 games for the 76ers last season.

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: Three-time NBA All-Star Julius Randle intends to sign a new three-year, $100 million deal to stay with the Minnesota Timberwolves, sources tell ESPN. The deal includes a player option for the 2027-28 season. https://t.co/j8fKA45gXu

text: Statement from NBA spokesman Mike Bass: “We are cooperating with the federal prosecutors’ investigation.”

author: ShamsCharania
text: Reporting for @SportsCenter -- U.S. District Attorney's office investigating Detroit guard Malik Beasley for allegedly gambling on NBA games, prop bets during the 2023-24 season: https://t.co/RWirWOEHsi

author: ShamsCharania
text: Los Angeles Lakers forward Dorian Finney-Smith is declining his $15.4 million player option for the 2025-26 season and will enter free agency, sources tell ESPN. Multiple contending teams are expected to pursue Finney-Smith beginning Monday night and a Lakers return is possible. https://t.co/BlYf5Fzplj

author: ShamsCharania
text: Beasley and the Pistons were in serious talks on a new three-year, $42 million contract to bring the free agent sharpshooter back to Detroit, but now talks are on pause, sources said.

author: ShamsCharania
text: “An investigation is not a charge,” Beasley’s attorney, Steve Haney, told ESPN. “Malik is afforded the same right of the presumption of innocence as anyone else under the U.S. constitution. As of now he has not been charged with anything.”

author: ShamsCharania
text: BREAKING: The U.S. District Attorney’s office is investigating Detroit Pistons guard Malik Beasley on allegations of gambling related to NBA games and prop bets, sources told ESPN. Serious development surrounding one of the top NBA free agents. https://t.co/U0W1QONYva

text: I officially wrapped up my final work on the 2023-24 NBA season and merged the data into my master database. The total number of injuries I have catalogued since the 2005-06 season now surpasses 31,000, running from Abdur-Rahim to Zubac.
